etymology.description: 爫 ('hand, claw') + 又 ('hand') -> combination of hands or claws suggesting an action or a phonetic role -> 爰
etymology.interpretation: The character 爰(yuán) likely symbolizes a hand or claws in action, represented by the components 爫 ('hand, claw') and 又 ('hand'), which emphasize the use of hands or tactile action. It was likely employed for phonetic purposes in other characters.
